caption: First time eating raw foods after a cleanse and I was pleased with the knowledgeable staff teaching me about each product. That takes time so thank you.

Was super excited to try out this place since me and my boyfriend recently went vegan. We made the 40min trip to the store. Let me just say the customer service you receive there is amazing! The staff is friendly and gladly goes through any products you have questions on. Unfortunately they have missed the main point of the store. The food... We bought for $70 1 4pack of carrot raisin muffin, 2 tiramisu, 1 veggie rolls and 1 of their home made pesto.  The carrot muffins were horrible...stale, hard and almost inedible. The tiramisu witch is usually my favorite dessert(before I went vegan) was nothing like tiramisu not even close...but was an okay dessert. Would not buy again though. The veggie rolls soggy, old, and the flavors did not complement each other. Don’t waste your money on those! The home made pesto sauce is amazing! 10/10! Overall I will not be returning to this store. I love the idea but is not executed well...at all. Over all their food is over priced and stale/old.
By far the best Sushi in the world for vegetarians.  Only down side is you better be patient as lines are at least an hour long if not 2 on weekends....
The milkshake was sorcery. 10/10 would order it again. The burger didn't disappoint either. Im not a vegan, but I do like how they give vegans the option to 'live it up' with the double-double.
Healthy, unprocessed, energizing!
I’m going to echo my review of the other location... staff is extremely kind & the food is amazing! The French Market has great vegan options

We met with friends at this place for lunch. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was a winning. The staff members welcomed us with a smile and we had a fantastic feeling. The meal was tasty. We enjoyed every moment and we will visit this place again. We recommend this place to all.
UM, 3 words: incredible, delicious and nurturing. Pumpkin pie? Yes. Ride the Tide? YEP. And the ginger-lemon elixir packs a punch. Thankful for real food.
Pricey

Do not waste your time or money. Acai bowl has a Bland flavor and apparently "fresh fruit" is just strawberry, no other options.  You are basically paying for just the container.  This is their advertised "16 oz"

Staff is awesome and the food was delicious as always. One of my favorites is the Lasagne. Such a pity that I don't live in Chicago. Whenever I'll be back in this city, this is the place I will visit for sure.
The Flying Falafel is a great place to go for a takeaway lunch or dinner. Very friendly staff and yummy (huge) all vegan menu. Would highly recommend!

I was desperate for an Acai Bowl and referred to google for a recommendation.  The bowl was minimal in its ingredients for the price and I was shocked to see agave as an ingredient.  Agave is dangerously high in fructose which leads to degraded liver function, deep belly fat, and obesity among other issues.  No health conscious establishment should use agave as a sweetener.  Bananas in the base of acai is an economical and healthier option.  My bowl had blueberries and kale in the base - not very tasty.
So good. Love coming here. Wish they had a location in bucktown or Whole Foods still carried it. It’s the only raw food left in Chicago and they do it really good!

Everything is unique and unlike anything else you would see somewhere else. There are a ton of plate options that include pastas, salads, and "grill" options. Watch out for their SLICE OF HEAVEN! It's amazing. Prices range $10 and up.

I m a big fan of raw food , and they have a great selections of superfood - unfortunately my experience was not that great , at least for the price that I paid. The pre package meal that I got was at least from the day before, ( I arrived early in the morning , anyway if they are open and if they charge premium price they should have fresh food and it wasn’t absolutely fresh ) also they should improve the packaging and the  stand presentation to match the actual food to go standards.  I ll definitely give them another chance
Great food. Kind service. Worth checking out and hope to go back again.

3 year vegan in our family. Happy with the flavors but some warning on the spicey food would’ve been nice.  Made our pallet less happy the second half of the meal. The avocado/lemon squares made up for it but the apple crisp was way overpriced and way too big of a portion at that.

Nice to find a completely plant-based vegan place that doesn't rely on fake meat options.  Delicious and large portions but on the more expensive side. My kelp and seaweed based Pad Thai was amazing and came with a small desert but ran me $15. I couldn't eat it all in one sitting though. Other things to note:  meals were premade and they didn't have every option on the menu out and couldn't make anything but smoothies on order.  Staff was friendly and i would eat here again as a special treat.  You pay more for real food these days....
good.. not worth the price though

The food has been known to be excellent, but that was about 2 years ago.  The quality has sadly been compromised.  Entrees are inconsistent, some days there will be orange wedges in the $12 Kale salad, other days there won't.  This is across the board and not what one should expect when you are paying PREMIUM prices for pre-packaged food to go.  Good luck trying to share an opinion or give the owners feedback, they have NEVER returned my calls.  I've tried reaching them 3x over the past 2 years.  Now I NEVER go there and will not recommend the overpriced inconsistent food to anyone.  Such a shame!  :(
Unhelpful, unknowledgeable staff. Very unpalatable food. Tasty "Apple pie", though

I appreciate more tasty vegan options in my city but twice now the packaging has said one price & I have been charged another. It's been only a couple of dollars difference but, at one point, the price had recently changed and I had just enough in cash and then not enough even though the label said the previous price. I pointed this out, especially when their credit card reader was down & the person working couldn't care less. This was for a gift for a friend that I had made a specific trip downtown for & was really embarrassing when other people in line ended up trying to offer me money when I was distraught about it.  I sent an email to the company and literally got no response. The city makes it expensive for small businesses to survive & I get that but when you raise prices like that repeatedly without warning even on the packages and have zero empathy, people will just end up not seeing the benefit of supporting your independent business.
Lots of to-go options for lunch or dinner, plus sweets. Staff very friendly.
The falafel sandwich was disgusting, even the sides were bad. I would rather go to native foods, because they know how to make healthy food delicious. Staff were friendly!
Great Food and high energy staff.  Very pleasant experience.
Not worth the money. Tried the desert, not good and overpriced. Will be going to native more often.
Something you rarely see at take-out places is the enthusiasm and outstanding customer service that I experienced. The food is amazing too- try the empanadas.

My first time eating raw food & my mind is blown. I can only dream of possessing such amazing culinary muscles. One of those rare days where I def don't feel like I'm missing out bc I'm vegan.*  Got the sample platter ($14; very filling) & it was a good pick. My first time having zucchini pasta & I'm a huge pasta fan, so I've been skeptical about carb-free pasta, but this was delish! The meatball & veggie burger were astounding. I have no idea what they put in it, but the texture & flavor is soo good! The most ingenious items was the ravioli, made with paper-thin turnips folded over cashew cheese. I can eat this everyday.
Tasty, healthy, high end vegetarian food at a decent price. Lovely.
Great raw vegan foods and deserts!
So Good!!!

Some really interesting alternative offerings for RAW fanatics, and meat eaters alike. I especially recommend the turnip and cashew ravioli, and the zucchini pasta. Not a cheap spot though, so pack your wallet and expect to pay a lot more than would be typical for their portions.
As a non-vegan/non-raw eater who was simply curious, I loved Chicago Raw.  Nice people, lots of samples, and lots to sample.  Would definitely recommend.
Everything is delightful and super tasty, ,, loved it!
Prices were crazy.

Sadly, Everything is super processed, they use agave for everything, tons of salt, which means tons of sodium and tons of oils! Juices are not organic and the price is the same if not more than the fresh cold pressed juices you can find at other places being 100% organic.

I define raw food as "food prepared from raw ingredients, without artificial or processed ingredients."  And this market/restuaruant does not disappoint.  The energy of the employees is well matched by the flavorful energy in the food.  I walked away with a couple items more than planned, and a girl in the shop gave me 1/2 a bottle of almond milk to try!  What a lovely first experience.  Going back again today.

Nothing here is cooked, all raw, but it must be processed in some way to achieve the look some of it has. While I enjoyed the raw food, the prices were not very enjoyable. It is very difficult to eat healthy with prices as high as they have here. It was very discouraging.
A life saver for any raw vegan visiting downtown Chicago!

I've only been to the location on Huron, but I know the food is the same. I have to say, it's freaking amazing what they do with raw food. I've tried almost everything-- the raviolis are so cool, the sandwiches are pretty delish and even pretty filling. The one thing I just can't get down with was the chocolate desert cup thing, not sweet at all and in general pretty gross. This place is a little too expensive for daily lunching (a small fresh juice will run you $10), but it is a nice option for switching it up a little and feeling extra healthy.

This review is for one in Huron street.  I didn't realized until today this place was opened in the neighborhood.  clean friendly owner offer sampling variety: pre-made food, icecream, drink, yogurt, even skincare line!  I tried pasta and holiday flavored icecream today. icecream was really good....I will go back for sure to get it more

I consider a $25 lunch a splurge; however, the food is of very high quality, laboriously prepared, and in my opinion worth every penny!  Each dish is unique, and raw or mostly raw (some sides, such as the couscous, is partially cooked/steamed), but most important: very well-seasoned and delicious.  They usually offer samples of multiple menu items, even to repeat customers (it helps me decide what I'm in the mood  to eat that day!)  The desserts are especially delectable--I just love that they are made with very healthy ingredients, and not overly sweet.

I am not a vegan.  Nor am I a vegetarian.  You can pretty much say that I am NOT Raw's target audience. That being said on occasion I do try to eat healthy (when I rarely try to fool myself into thinking I can keep that up.)  So when I've tried in the area Raw really stands out as one of the few places who can cater to a healthier lifestyle. While the prices are a bit much for what you get the taste is fantastic! Not only that but the staff is both friendly and willing to answer any questions on the subject of what is in the food or suggestions that you might have for them.  If I was ever going to try to go vegetarian I know that I'd be spending a lot of time here.
Fast raw food. Tough to beat downtown for seriously healthy and raw. Not cheap, but raw food is very labor intensive. "Pizza" is great.

Calling everyone who want to experience optimum health via a raw vegan diet - this is the best place to go! This small cafe tucked in s corner of the French Market gives you flavor you can savor. All of the salads are great. The raw pizza is delicious & the the empanada entree is my favorite. Try out the sampler if you're a newbie. The raw burger entree,3 for $11, is a must - heck add a salad & you have 3 meals. There's also a bonus! Each entree comes with a raw desert sample...you can't beat that! If you want to do a raw food detox signup for the meal plan. The owners are onsite often and they are two of the most kind, beautiful and helpful ladies that I've met. There's eat raw vegan food then there's RAW the place where you get bang for your buck, if you make the right selection. RAW Chicago rocks!

The Raw is by far the best place for raw food in Chicago area. The quality and freshness of food is amazing, other restaurants have a lot to learn from this small train station joint. Some of my favs are lasanga, burgers, salmon pate and everything else! Should I even bother to name the deserts? Do yourself a favor, get orange chocolate truffles. And try weekly takeaway menu, you'll never want to "cook" again.
I don't believe all food needs to be uncooked, but the pizza and dessert I had were delicious.

I stopped by Chicago Raw yesterday for lunch with a few friends and was blown away by the food. Carol was incredibly sweet and very helpful. I'll definitely be making more trips to the city from the suburbs just to eat the happy and delicious food that can be purchased here.
Chicago Raw is a great place for fresh organic food. The veggie juice is great and the apple parfait is excellent! The owners really care about awareness and health.
This is a really nice place, great smoothies. I wish the menu changed more often, or was expanded further.

This is by far the tastiest Raw food in Chicago. Better than Karyn's, definitely better that Cousin's! Their pizza is to die for, and the sushi is so good - I dream about it sometimes. The service is the friendliest in town. I would give it 6 stars on everything.
